text: Ján Vlasko (born 11 January 1990) is a Slovak footballer who plays for Spartak Trnava as an attacking midfielder. ==Club career== Born in Bojnice, Vlasko began playing youth football for Prievidza. He also played for the youth sides of Sparta Prague and Dubnica. In 2007, Vlasko joined Czech Gambrinus liga side Slovan Liberec. He made his professional debut for Slovan Liberec, entering as a second-half substitute against Sparta Prague, in May 2007. He joined Spartak Trnava in August 2012 and made his debut for them against Žilina on 21 August 2012.Trnavčania odchádzajú zo Žiliny s jedným bodom 21.08.2012, profutbal.sk Zagłębie Lubin bought Vlasko in July 2015 for a fee of €0.18 million. == Honours == Spartak Trnava * Slovak Super Liga: 2017–18 ==References== ==External links== * * FC Spartak Trnava profile * Category:1990 births Category:Living people Category:People from Bojnice Category:Association football midfielders Category:Slovak footballers Category:FK Mesto Prievidza players Category:AC Sparta Prague players Category:FK Dubnica players Category:FC Slovan Liberec players Category:FK Senica players Category:Zagłębie Lubin players Category:Puskás Akadémia FC players Category:Ekstraklasa players Category:Slovak Super Liga players Category:Czech First League players Category:Nemzeti Bajnokság I players Category:Slovak expatriate footballers Category:Expatriate footballers in the Czech Republic Category:Slovak expatriate sportspeople in the Czech Republic Category:Expatriate footballers in Poland Category:Slovak expatriate sportspeople in Poland Category:Expatriate footballers in Hungary Category:Slovak expatriate sportspeople in Hungary
title: Ján Vlasko
